snippet: Fresh Direct, an online grocer that employs 1,800 workers, has an offer of tax breaks, land and other subsidies worth $100 million to move to Jersey City.
abstract: New Jersey is aggressively trying to lure Fresh Direct, online grocer based in Queens that employs 1,800 people, across the Hudson River to Jersey City with a $100 million package of tax breaks, land and other subsidies; New York State officials and the Bloomberg administration are countering with a deal that they hope will keep the company in New York, and express anger that Gov Chris Christie of New Jersey is again waging war for New York jobs.
lead_paragraph: Fresh Direct, an online grocer that employs 1,800 workers, has an offer of tax breaks, land and other subsidies worth $100 million to move to Jersey City.

headline.seo: Fresh Direct Has $100 Million Offer From New Jersey
headline.main: New Jersey Tries to Lure Fresh Direct From Queens
headline.print_headline: New Jersey Tries to Lure Fresh Direct From Queens
